# AMETEK, Inc. (AME) - Comprehensive Analysis Report

## 1. Company Overview

AMETEK, Inc. is an American multinational conglomerate and global designer and manufacturer of electronic instruments and electromechanical devices with headquarters in the United States and over 150 sites worldwide. The company was founded in 1930. Today, AMETEK is a market-leading, global provider of highly differentiated technology solutions. With over 40 businesses across 30 countries, our asset-light business model generates strong sales growth and margin expansion with robust cash flows, leading to exceptional shareholder returns.

The company's original name, American Machine and Metals, was changed to AMETEK in the early 1960s, reflecting its evolution from a provider of heavy machinery to a manufacturer of analytical instruments, precision components and specialty materials. AMETEK, Inc. manufactures and sells electronic instruments (EIG) and electromechanical (EMG) devices in the United States and internationally. The firm has two operating groups (the Electronic Instruments Group and the Electromechanical Group).

According to Ametek's website, the company had $7.5 billion in annualized sales as of Q4 2025. AMETEK is listed on the New York Stock Exchange. Its common stock is a component of the S&P 500 index and the Russell 1000 index.

## 3. Existing Products/Services

AMETEK operates through two main segments:

**Electronic Instruments Group (EIG):**
EIG segment designs and manufactures advanced analytical, test and measurement instruments for the process, aerospace, medical, research, power and industrial markets.

**Electromechanical Group (EMG):**
Its EMG segment offers engineered medical components and devices, automation solutions, thermal management systems, specialty metals, and electrical interconnects; single-use and consumable surgical instruments, implantable components, and drug delivery systems; engineered electrical connectors and electronics packaging to protect sensitive electronic devices; precision motion control products for data storage, medical devices, business equipment, and automation; high-purity powdered metals, strips and foils, specialty clad metals, and metal matrix composites; motor-blower systems and heat exchangers for thermal management, military and commercial aircraft, and military ground vehicles; and motors for commercial appliances, food and beverage machines, hydraulic pumps, and industrial blowers, as well as operates a network of aviation maintenance, repair, and overhaul facilities.

## 4. Planned Products/Services/Projects

FARO Technologies and Creaform, businesses of AMETEK, Inc., are announcing a major new chapter in their evolutions which will reframe how industries approach metrology and reality capture. With headquarters in Lévis, Québec, Canada and Lake Mary, Florida, USA, FARO CREAFORM is the result of the combination of FARO's renowned 3D Measurement business segment and Creaform's innovative metrology solutions.

FARO INSIGHT builds on FARO's legacy in digital reality, offering advanced solutions for reality capture, laser projection, and vision systems. FARO INSIGHT enables teams to capture, understand, and share reality data with confidence, supporting decision-making in construction, geospatial, and investigative fields.

## 5. Growth Strategy

The overall strategy for the organization is made up of 4 components: Operational Excellence (cost control), New Product Development, International/Market Expansion, and Acquisitions.

The AMETEK Growth Model integrates the Four Growth Strategies - Operational Excellence, Technology Innovation, Global and Market Expansion, and Strategic Acquisitions - with a disciplined focus on cash generation and capital deployment. AMETEK's objective is double-digit percentage growth in earnings per share over the business cycle and a superior return on total capital.

## 6. Current and Potential Major Clients

AMETEK serves diverse markets including:
• Process, aerospace, power, and industrial markets
• Oil and gas, petrochemical, pharmaceutical, semiconductor industries
• Laboratory equipment and ultra-precision manufacturing sectors
• Medical and test measurement markets
• Military and commercial aircraft manufacturers
• Data storage, medical devices, and business equipment manufacturers

## 7. Financial Data & Performance

**Q3 2025 Results:**
• AMETEK's third quarter 2025 sales were a record $1.89 billion, an 11% increase over the third quarter of 2024.
• Adjusted earnings in the quarter were a record $1.89 per diluted share, up 14% from the third quarter of 2024.
• Adjusted EBITDA was $599.2 million, resulting in a 31.7% margin.
• Organic revenue grew 4% year over year.

**2024 Performance:**
• In 2024, AMETEK's revenue was $6.94 billion, an increase of 5.22% compared to the previous year's $6.60 billion. Earnings were $1.38 billion, an increase of 4.79%.

**2025 Guidance:**
• Adjusted earnings per diluted share are now expected to be in the range of $7.32 to $7.37, up 7% to 8% over the comparable basis for 2024.

## 8. Headwinds & Tailwinds

**Tailwinds:**
• Aerospace and defense, close to 20% of sales, are expected to sustain high single digit growth, supported by commercial aircraft production and stable defense demand.
• Utilities continue to provide steady support, while commercial aerospace should accelerate as aircraft build rates rise. Medical and life sciences and factory automation, which have been weaker, are seen improving off low levels.
• Both companies are benefiting from the "Robot Revolution," where industrial automation is moving from experimental phases to full-scale AI-driven deployment.

**Headwinds:**
• Intense Competition: Ametek faces competition from well-established companies in the electronic instruments and electromechanical devices markets. Competitive pressures can impact market share and profitability.
• Supply Chain Disruptions: Disruptions in the supply chain, such as those caused by geopolitical tensions or natural disasters, can affect Ametek's ability to source materials and deliver products.

## 9. Market Shares

The company emphasizes product differentiation and market leadership in the niche markets where it operates. While specific market share percentages are not disclosed, AMETEK is described as holding leading positions across its various niche markets. Ametek's pipeline of potential acquisitions is vast as the markets in which it operates are highly fragmented.

## 11. Partnerships, Mergers and Acquisitions

**Major Recent Acquisition:**
AMETEK, Inc. (NYSE: AME) today announced that it has completed its acquisition of FARO Technologies, Inc. for $44.00 per share in cash, or approximately $920 million, net of cash acquired. (Completed July 21, 2025)

FARO had annual sales of approximately $340 million. FARO's leadership in 3D metrology and digital reality solutions enhances our capabilities in precision measurement and supports our expansion into attractive market segments.

**Other Acquisitions:**
